semantic_title: Pressure Ulcers Documented as Healing Coding Guidelines
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 12. Chapter 12: Diseases of the Skin and Subcutaneous Tissue > a. Pressure ulcer stage codes > 5) Pressure ulcers documented as healing

content.full_text: Pressure ulcers described as healing should be assigned the appropriate pressure ulcer stage code based on the documentation in the medical record. If the documentation does not provide information about the stage of the healing pressure ulcer, assign the appropriate code for unspecified stage. If the documentation is unclear as to whether the patient has a current (new) pressure ulcer or if the patient is being treated for a healing pressure ulcer, query the provider. For ulcers that were present on admission but healed at the time of discharge, assign the code for the site and stage of the pressure ulcer at the time of admission. (Evidence: pg no: 59, L46-L48)
content.summary: Comprehensive guidelines for coding healing pressure ulcers, including stage assignment, provider queries, and admission to discharge scenarios (Evidence: pg no: 59, L46-L48)
key_concepts: Healing ulcers require stage coding (Evidence: pg no: 59, L46-L47)
Unspecified stage for undocumented healing ulcers (Evidence: pg no: 59, L47)
Provider query for unclear documentation (Evidence: pg no: 59, L47-L48)
Admission stage coding for ulcers healed at discharge (Evidence: pg no: 59, L48)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Healing pressure ulcers should be assigned appropriate stage code based on documentation (Evidence: pg no: 59, L46-L47)
detailed_rules.explanation: Pressure ulcers that are healing are still active conditions requiring stage-specific coding based on medical record documentation (Evidence: pg no: 59, L46-L47)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use unspecified stage code when healing ulcer stage is not documented (Evidence: pg no: 59, L47)
detailed_rules.explanation: If documentation describes ulcer as healing but does not provide stage information, assign the unspecified stage code (Evidence: pg no: 59, L47)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Query provider when unclear if ulcer is new or healing (Evidence: pg no: 59, L47-L48)
detailed_rules.explanation: When documentation is unclear about whether the patient has a new pressure ulcer or is being treated for a healing one, provider clarification is needed (Evidence: pg no: 59, L47-L48)

detailed_rules.rule_text: For ulcers present at admission but healed at discharge, code admission stage (Evidence: pg no: 59, L48)
detailed_rules.explanation: When ulcers were present on admission but healed by discharge, assign the code for the site and stage at the time of admission (Evidence: pg no: 59, L48)

workflow_steps: Step 2: Check documentation for stage information
Step 3: If stage documented, assign appropriate stage code
Step 4: If stage not documented, use unspecified stage
Step 5: If unclear new vs healing, query provider
Step 6: For admission ulcers healed at discharge, use admission stage
